AttributeDefinition.name: cn
AttributeDefinition.Description: common name(s) for which the entity is known by

AttributeDefinition.name: departmentNumber
AttributeDefinition.Description: identifies a department within an organization

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: preferred name to be used when displaying entries

AttributeDefinition.name: distinguishedName
AttributeDefinition.Description: distinguished name for which the entity is known by

AttributeDefinition.name: employeeNumber
AttributeDefinition.Description: numerically identifies an employee within an organization

AttributeDefinition.name: employeeType
AttributeDefinition.Description: type of employment for a person

AttributeDefinition.name: givenName
AttributeDefinition.Description: first name(s) for which the entity is known by

AttributeDefinition.name: initials
AttributeDefinition.Description: initials of some or all of names, but not the surname(s).

AttributeDefinition.name: ou
AttributeDefinition.Description: organizational unit this object belongs to

AttributeDefinition.name: preferredLanguage
AttributeDefinition.Description: preferred written or spoken language for a person

AttributeDefinition.name: sn
AttributeDefinition.Description: last (family) name(s) for which the entity is known by

AttributeDefinition.name: st
AttributeDefinition.Description: state or province which this object resides in

AttributeDefinition.name: accountFlags
AttributeDefinition.Description: List of the flags enabled on an account

AttributeDefinition.name: externalEmailAddress
AttributeDefinition.Description: External email address of Mail User

AttributeDefinition.name: msRTCSIP-UserEnabled
AttributeDefinition.Description: User enabled for Skype for Business Server

AttributeDefinition.name: LyncPinSet
AttributeDefinition.Description: Skype for Business user pin set status

AttributeDefinition.name: LyncPinLockedOut
AttributeDefinition.Description: Skype for Business user pin lock status

AttributeDefinition.name: msDS-PrincipalName
AttributeDefinition.Description: Name of the entity in the format "NetBIOS domain name\sAMAccountName"

AttributeDefinition.name: employeeID
AttributeDefinition.Description: numerically identifies an employee within an organization

AttributeDefinition.name: cn
AttributeDefinition.Description: common name(s) for which the entity is known by

AttributeDefinition.name: distinguishedName
AttributeDefinition.Description: distinguished name for which the entity is known by

AttributeDefinition.name: msDS-PrincipalName
AttributeDefinition.Description: Name of the entity in the format "NetBIOS domain name\sAMAccountName"

AttributeDefinition.name: ou
AttributeDefinition.Description: organizational unit this object belongs to

Application.featuresString: UNLOCK, SEARCH, PROVISIONING, SYNC_PROVISIONING, ENABLE, PASSWORD, AUTHENTICATE
Application.name: SAP G53

AttributeDefinition.name: Language CR P
AttributeDefinition.Description: CR P language of the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Language UCP ISO
AttributeDefinition.Description: CP ISO language of the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Language UP ISO
AttributeDefinition.Description: P ISO language of the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Pager SMS List
AttributeDefinition.Description: Pager or SMS number list in the format pager_type#pager_number

AttributeDefinition.name: Parameters
AttributeDefinition.Description: Parameter list in the format prameter_ID=parameter_value

AttributeDefinition.name: PO Box City
AttributeDefinition.Description: PO box number of the city

AttributeDefinition.name: PO Box City ISO
AttributeDefinition.Description: PO box number of the ISO city

AttributeDefinition.name: PO Box Country
AttributeDefinition.Description: PO box number of the country

AttributeDefinition.name: PO Box Region
AttributeDefinition.Description: PO box number of the region

AttributeDefinition.name: Remote Mail List
AttributeDefinition.Description: Remote mail list of the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Searc Term2 P
AttributeDefinition.Description: 2nd search term P for the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Search Term P
AttributeDefinition.Description: Search term P for the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Tax Jurisdiction Code
AttributeDefinition.Description: Tax jurisdiction code of the user

AttributeDefinition.name: URL Homepage List
AttributeDefinition.Description: URL (Homepage) address list in the format URI_type#URI_name

AttributeDefinition.name: Productive Password
AttributeDefinition.Description: User password set in permanent mode

AttributeDefinition.name: User Valid From
AttributeDefinition.Description: Valid from date for the user

AttributeDefinition.name: User Valid To
AttributeDefinition.Description: Valid to date for the user

AttributeDefinition.name: Contractual User Type ID
AttributeDefinition.Description: Contractual user types associated with user

AttributeDefinition.name: Subsystem
AttributeDefinition.Description: System Name for CUA System Aggregation

AttributeDefinition.name: Generated Profile
AttributeDefinition.Description: System Generated Profile associated to Role which in turn has Authorizations.

AttributeDefinition.name: ID
AttributeDefinition.Description: Profile Name along with its Description

AttributeDefinition.name: Subsystem
AttributeDefinition.Description: System Name for CUA System Aggregation

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: Unique identifier for the User typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider. Each User MUST include a non-empty id value. This identifier MUST be unique across the Service Consumer's entire set of Users.

AttributeDefinition.name: externalId
AttributeDefinition.Description: An identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client. OPTIONAL

AttributeDefinition.name: userName
AttributeDefinition.Description: Unique identifier for the User typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider. Each User MUST include a non-empty userName value. This identifier MUST be unique across the Service Consumer's entire set of Users. REQUIRED

AttributeDefinition.name: name.formatted
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full name, including all middle names, titles, and suffixes as appropriate, formatted for display (e.g., Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III.).

AttributeDefinition.name: name.familyName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The family name of the User, or Last Name in most Western languages (e.g. Jensen given the full name Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III.).

AttributeDefinition.name: name.givenName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The given name of the User, or First Name in most Western languages (e.g. Barbara given the full name Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III.).

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the User, suitable for display to end-users. The name SHOULD be the full name of the User being described if known

AttributeDefinition.name: active
AttributeDefinition.Description: A Boolean value indicating the User's administrative status.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.primary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.secondary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.primary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.secondary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.primary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.secondary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

AttributeDefinition.name: manager
AttributeDefinition.Description: The User's manager. A complex type that optionally allows Service Providers to represent organizational hierarchy by referencing the 'id' attribute of another User.

AttributeDefinition.name: accounts
AttributeDefinition.Description: Simple representation of the Account (or Link) ResourceType

AttributeDefinition.name: riskScore
AttributeDefinition.Description: composite risk score of this user

AttributeDefinition.name: lastRefresh
AttributeDefinition.Description: when was the last time this user was refreshed?

AttributeDefinition.name: descriptions.locale
AttributeDefinition.Description: The locale associated with this Entitlement description.

AttributeDefinition.name: application.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The Application associated with the Entitlement.

AttributeDefinition.name: application.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the Entitlement Application.

AttributeDefinition.name: application.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the Entitlement Application. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the Entitlement Owner.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the Entitlement Owner.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayName of the Entitlement Owner. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: requestable
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag to indicate this entitlement is requestable.

AttributeDefinition.name: aggregated
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag to indicate this entitlement has been aggregated.

AttributeDefinition.name: lastRefresh
AttributeDefinition.Description: The last refresh date of the Entitlement.

AttributeDefinition.name: lastTargetAggregation
AttributeDefinition.Description: The date aggregation was last targeted of the Entitlement.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.name
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name associated with the Role Type.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The display name associated with the Role Type.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.assignmentSelector
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag indicating that roles of this type should have an assignment selector. This is normally false for IT roles and container roles and true for business roles.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.autoAssignment
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag indicating that roles of this type can be automatically assigned. This is normally false for IT roles and container roles and true for business roles.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.iiq
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag to indicate that a role should be allowed to contain IdentityIQ properties like capabilities and rights.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.manualAssignment
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag indicating that roles of this type may be manually assigned. This is normally true for business roles and false for IT and container roles.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.permits
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag to indicate that roles should have a permits list. Normally this is false for business roles and true for IT roles.

AttributeDefinition.name: type.requirements
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag to indicate that roles should have a requirements list. Normally this is false for business roles and true for IT roles.

AttributeDefinition.name: descriptions.locale
AttributeDefinition.Description: The locale associated with this Role description.

AttributeDefinition.name: active
AttributeDefinition.Description: Flag to indicate this Role is enabled or active.

AttributeDefinition.name: activationDate
AttributeDefinition.Description: The date the Role will turn from inactive/disabled to active/enabled.

AttributeDefinition.name: deactivationDate
AttributeDefinition.Description: The date the Role will turn from active/enabled to inactive/disabled.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the Role Owner.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the Role Owner.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayName of the Role Owner. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: inheritance.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the Role.

AttributeDefinition.name: inheritance.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the Role.

AttributeDefinition.name: inheritance.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayName of the Role. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: requirements.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the Role.

AttributeDefinition.name: requirements.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the Role.

AttributeDefinition.name: requirements.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayName of the Role. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: permits.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the Role.

AttributeDefinition.name: permits.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the Role.

AttributeDefinition.name: permits.displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayName of the Role. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: soxRelevant
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the role impacts Sarbanes-Oxley standards compliance

AttributeDefinition.name: nercRelevant
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the role impacts NERC standards compliance

AttributeDefinition.name: adminRole
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates whether entitlements from this role need to be applied to an administrative, rather than normal account

AttributeDefinition.name: isoRelevant
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the role impacts ISO27001 standards compliance

AttributeDefinition.name: pciRelevant
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the role impacts PCI-DSS standards compliance

entry.value: SELECT * FROM {{targetname}}__ENT_MASTER WHERE UPPER(ENT_TARGET_NAME)=UPPER('{{targetname}}') ORDER BY ENT_CODE
SELECT * FROM {{targetname}}_ACCT_ENT WHERE UPPER(ACCT_TARGET_NAME)=UPPER('{{targetname}}') ORDER BY ACCT_USERID

Application.featuresString: DISCOVER_SCHEMA, PROVISIONING, SYNC_PROVISIONING, ENABLE, PASSWORD, UNSTRUCTURED_TARGETS
Application.name: Privileged Access Management

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the User.

AttributeDefinition.name: userName
AttributeDefinition.Description: Unique identifier for the User, typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider.

AttributeDefinition.name: name.formatted
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full name, including all middle names, titles, and suffixes as appropriate, formatted for display (e.g., 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.familyName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The family name of the User, or last name in most Western languages (e.g., 'Jensen' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.givenName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The given name of the User, or first name in most Western languages (e.g., 'Barbara' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.middleName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The middle name(s) of the User (e.g., 'Jane' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.honorificPrefix
AttributeDefinition.Description: The honorific prefix(es) of the User, or title in most Western languages (e.g., 'Ms.' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.honorificSuffix
AttributeDefinition.Description: The honorific suffix(es) of the User, or suffix in most Western languages (e.g., 'III' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the User, suitable for display to end-users. The name SHOULD be the full name of the User being described, if known.

AttributeDefinition.name: nickName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The casual way to address the user in real life, e.g., 'Bob' or 'Bobby' instead of 'Robert'. This attribute SHOULD NOT be used to represent a User's username (e.g., 'bjensen' or 'mpepperidge').

AttributeDefinition.name: profileUrl
AttributeDefinition.Description: A fully qualified URL pointing to a page representing the User's online profile.

AttributeDefinition.name: title
AttributeDefinition.Description: The user's title, such as "Vice President."

AttributeDefinition.name: userType
AttributeDefinition.Description: Used to identify the relationship between the organization and the user. Typical values used might be 'Contractor', 'Employee', 'Intern', 'Temp', 'External', and 'Unknown', but any value may be used.

AttributeDefinition.name: preferredLanguage
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates the User's preferred written or spoken language. Generally used for selecting a localized user interface; e.g., 'en_US' specifies the language English and country US.

AttributeDefinition.name: locale
AttributeDefinition.Description: Used to indicate the User's default location for purposes of localizing items such as currency, date time format, or numerical representations.

AttributeDefinition.name: timezone
AttributeDefinition.Description: The User's time zone in the 'Olson' time zone database format, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'.

AttributeDefinition.name: active
AttributeDefinition.Description: A Boolean value indicating the User's administrative status.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.work.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Phone number for the user. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.work.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.home.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Phone number for the user. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.home.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.cellular.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Phone number for the user. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.cellular.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.pager.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Phone number for the user. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.pager.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.fax.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Phone number for the user. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: phoneNumbers.fax.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: groups
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of groups to which the user belongs, either through direct membership, through nested groups, or dynamically calculated.

AttributeDefinition.name: entitlements
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of entitlements for the User that represent a thing the User has.

AttributeDefinition.name: roles
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of roles for the User that collectively represent who the User is, e.g., 'Student', 'Faculty'.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.work.formatted
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full mailing address, formatted for display or use with a mailing label.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.work.postalCode
AttributeDefinition.Description: The zip code or postal code component.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.work.country
AttributeDefinition.Description: The country name component. When specified, the value MUST be in ISO 3166-1 "alpha-2" code format.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.home.formatted
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full mailing address, formatted for display or use with a mailing label.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.home.postalCode
AttributeDefinition.Description: The zip code or postal code component.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.home.country
AttributeDefinition.Description: The country name component. When specified, the value MUST be in ISO 3166-1 "alpha-2" code format.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.other.formatted
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full mailing address, formatted for display or use with a mailing label.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.other.postalCode
AttributeDefinition.Description: The zip code or postal code component.

AttributeDefinition.name: addresses.other.country
AttributeDefinition.Description: The country name component. When specified, the value MUST be in ISO 3166-1 "alpha-2" code format.

AttributeDefinition.name: source
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the external application on which the object lives. If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: nativeIdentifier
AttributeDefinition.Description: The native identifier of the object on the external application (eg - the LDAP DN). If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: manager
AttributeDefinition.Description: The User's manager. A complex type that optionally allows Service Providers to represent organizational hierarchy by referencing the 'id' attribute of another User.

AttributeDefinition.name: organization
AttributeDefinition.Description: Identifies the name of an organization.

AttributeDefinition.name: department
AttributeDefinition.Description: Identifies the name of a department.

AttributeDefinition.name: fromHour
AttributeDefinition.Description: The time from which the User can log on.

AttributeDefinition.name: toHour
AttributeDefinition.Description: The time until which the User can log on.

AttributeDefinition.name: expirationDate
AttributeDefinition.Description: The date on which the user account expires.

AttributeDefinition.name: ldapFullDN
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full LDAP DN of the user in the external directory to which the external user belongs.

AttributeDefinition.name: ldapDirectory
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the LDAP external directory (as defined in CyberArk) to which the external user belongs.

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the Container

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The display name of the container. This is optional. If null, the name will be used as the display name.

AttributeDefinition.name: type
AttributeDefinition.Description: The type of container (eg - management set or account store). This is optional if the PAM system does not support multiple types of containers.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The ID of the user that owns this container

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: A URI reference to the user that owns this container.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: The display name of the user that owns this container

AttributeDefinition.name: privilegedData.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The ID of the privileged data.

AttributeDefinition.name: privilegedData.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: A URI reference to the PrivilegedData

AttributeDefinition.name: privilegedData.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayable value of the PrivilegedData

AttributeDefinition.name: supportOLAC
AttributeDefinition.Description: Whether or not Object Level Access is supported.

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the PrivilegedData.

AttributeDefinition.name: name
AttributeDefinition.Description: A descriptive name for this piece of PrivilegedData. For example, root@mylinuxhost

AttributeDefinition.name: description
AttributeDefinition.Description: A description for this piece of PrivilegedData.

AttributeDefinition.name: type
AttributeDefinition.Description: The type of PrivilegedData. The value will be dependent on what is supported by the PAM system. Examples include 'credential', 'ssh key', 'file', etc...

AttributeDefinition.name: properties
AttributeDefinition.Description: CyberArk Additional account properties (File Categories) that are defined, including internal properties.

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the Group

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name for the Group. REQUIRED.

AttributeDefinition.name: members
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of members of the Group.

AttributeDefinition.name: source
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the external application on which the object lives. If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: nativeIdentifier
AttributeDefinition.Description: The native identifier of the object on the external application (eg - the LDAP DN). If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: ldapFullDN
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full LDAP DN of the group in the external directory to which the external user belongs.

AttributeDefinition.name: ldapDirectory
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the LDAP external directory (as defined in CyberArk) to which the external group belongs.

Application.featuresString: DISCOVER_SCHEMA, PROVISIONING, SYNC_PROVISIONING, DIRECT_PERMISSIONS, ENABLE, UNLOCK
Application.name: IIQ

Application.featuresString: DISCOVER_SCHEMA, PROVISIONING, SYNC_PROVISIONING, DIRECT_PERMISSIONS, ENABLE, UNLOCK
Application.name: JDBC PAM Application

entry.value: SELECT c.id, c.name, c.displayname, c.description, c.type, c.ownerId as owner, cp.privileged_data_id as privilegedData, pd.name as `privilegedData.display`, pd.type as `privilegedData.type` FROM containers c LEFT OUTER JOIN container_priv_data_assignments cp on c.id = cp.container_id LEFT OUTER JOIN privileged_data pd on pd.id = cp.privileged_data_id ORDER BY c.id

SELECT c.id, c.name, c.displayname, c.description, c.type, c.ownerId as owner, cp.privileged_data_id as privilegedData, pd.name as `privilegedData.display`, pd.type as `privilegedData.type` FROM containers c LEFT OUTER JOIN container_priv_data_assignments cp on c.id = cp.container_id LEFT OUTER JOIN privileged_data pd on pd.id = cp.privileged_data_id WHERE c.id = '$(identity)' ORDER BY c.id

SELECT cp.id, cp.container_id as container, c.name as containerName, c.displayname as containerDisplayName, cp.user_id as user, u.displayName as userDisplayName, cp.group_id as `group`, g.displayName as groupDisplayName, cp.rights FROM container_permission_assignments cp inner join containers c on cp.container_id = c.id left outer join users u on cp.user_id = u.id left outer join groups g on cp.group_id = g.id

SELECT cp.id, cp.container_id as container, c.name as containerName, c.displayname as containerDisplayName, cp.user_id as user, u.displayName as userDisplayName, cp.group_id as `group`, g.displayName as groupDisplayName, cp.rights FROM container_permission_assignments cp inner join containers c on cp.container_id = c.id left outer join users u on cp.user_id = u.id left outer join groups g on cp.group_id = g.id WHERE cp.id = '$(identity)'
SELECT pd.id, pd.name, pd.description, pd.type FROM privileged_data pd
SELECT pd.id, pd.name, pd.description, pd.type FROM privileged_data pd WHERE pd.id = '$(identity)'

SELECT pdp.id, pdp.privileged_data_id as privilegedData, pd.name as privilegedDataName, pdp.user_id as user, u.displayName as userDisplayName, pdp.group_id as `group`, g.displayName as groupDisplayName, pdp.rights FROM priv_data_permission_assignments pdp inner join privileged_data pd on pdp.privileged_data_id = pd.id left outer join users u on pdp.user_id = u.id left outer join groups g on pdp.group_id = g.id

SELECT pdp.id, pdp.privileged_data_id as privilegedData, pd.name as privilegedDataName, pdp.user_id as user, u.displayName as userDisplayName, pdp.group_id as `group`, g.displayName as groupDisplayName, pdp.rights FROM priv_data_permission_assignments pdp inner join privileged_data pd on pdp.privileged_data_id = pd.id left outer join users u on pdp.user_id = u.id left outer join groups g on pdp.group_id = g.id WHERE pdp.id = '$(identity)'

SELECT u.id, u.userName, u.formattedName, u.familyName as lastname, u.givenName as firstname, u.middleName, u.honorificPrefix, u.honorificSuffix, u.displayName, u.nickname as nickName, u.profileURL as profileUrl, u.title, u.usertype as userType, u.preferredLanguage, u.locale, u.timezone, !u.active as IIQDisabled, u.email, u.source, u.source_native_identifier as sourceNativeIdentifier, g.id as groups, g.displayName as groupNames FROM users u left outer join user_group_assignments uga on uga.user_id = u.id left outer join groups g on g.id = uga.group_id ORDER BY u.id

SELECT u.id, u.userName, u.formattedName, u.familyName as lastname, u.givenName as firstname, u.middleName, u.honorificPrefix, u.honorificSuffix, u.displayName, u.nickname as nickName, u.profileURL as profileUrl, u.title, u.usertype as userType, u.preferredLanguage, u.locale, u.timezone, !u.active as IIQDisabled, u.email, u.source, u.source_native_identifier as sourceNativeIdentifier, g.id as groups, g.displayName as groupNames FROM users u left outer join user_group_assignments uga on uga.user_id = u.id left outer join groups g on g.id = uga.group_id WHERE u.id = '$(identity)'

SELECT g.id, g.displayName, g.parent_group_id, u.source, u.source_native_identifier as sourceNativeIdentifier, u.id as members, u.displayName as userDisplayNames FROM groups g left outer join user_group_assignments uga on uga.group_id = g.id left outer join users u on u.id = uga.user_id ORDER BY g.id

SELECT g.id, g.displayName, g.parent_group_id, u.source, u.source_native_identifier as sourceNativeIdentifier, u.id as members, u.displayName as userDisplayNames FROM groups g left outer join user_group_assignments uga on uga.group_id = g.id left outer join users u on u.id = uga.user_id WHERE g.id = '$(identity)'

Application.featuresString: DISCOVER_SCHEMA, PROVISIONING, SYNC_PROVISIONING, ENABLE, PASSWORD, UNSTRUCTURED_TARGETS
Application.name: Inventory

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the User.

AttributeDefinition.name: userName
AttributeDefinition.Description: Unique identifier for the User, typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider.

AttributeDefinition.name: name.formatted
AttributeDefinition.Description: The full name, including all middle names, titles, and suffixes as appropriate, formatted for display (e.g., 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.familyName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The family name of the User, or last name in most Western languages (e.g., 'Jensen' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.givenName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The given name of the User, or first name in most Western languages (e.g., 'Barbara' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.middleName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The middle name(s) of the User (e.g., 'Jane' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.honorificPrefix
AttributeDefinition.Description: The honorific prefix(es) of the User, or title in most Western languages (e.g., 'Ms.' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: name.honorificSuffix
AttributeDefinition.Description: The honorific suffix(es) of the User, or suffix in most Western languages (e.g., 'III' given the full name 'Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III').

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the User, suitable for display to end-users. The name SHOULD be the full name of the User being described, if known.

AttributeDefinition.name: nickName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The casual way to address the user in real life, e.g., 'Bob' or 'Bobby' instead of 'Robert'. This attribute SHOULD NOT be used to represent a User's username (e.g., 'bjensen' or 'mpepperidge').

AttributeDefinition.name: profileUrl
AttributeDefinition.Description: A fully qualified URL pointing to a page representing the User's online profile.

AttributeDefinition.name: title
AttributeDefinition.Description: The user's title, such as "Vice President."

AttributeDefinition.name: userType
AttributeDefinition.Description: Used to identify the relationship between the organization and the user. Typical values used might be 'Contractor', 'Employee', 'Intern', 'Temp', 'External', and 'Unknown', but any value may be used.

AttributeDefinition.name: preferredLanguage
AttributeDefinition.Description: Indicates the User's preferred written or spoken language. Generally used for selecting a localized user interface; e.g., 'en_US' specifies the language English and country US.

AttributeDefinition.name: locale
AttributeDefinition.Description: Used to indicate the User's default location for purposes of localizing items such as currency, date time format, or numerical representations.

AttributeDefinition.name: timezone
AttributeDefinition.Description: The User's time zone in the 'Olson' time zone database format, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'.

AttributeDefinition.name: active
AttributeDefinition.Description: A Boolean value indicating the User's administrative status.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.primary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.secondary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.primary.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.work.secondary.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.primary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.secondary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.primary.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.home.secondary.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.primary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.secondary.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: Email addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the service provider, e.g., 'bjensen@example.com' instead of 'bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM'. Canonical type values of 'work', 'home', and 'other'.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.primary.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: emails.other.secondary.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name, primarily used for display purposes. READ-ONLY.

AttributeDefinition.name: groups
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of groups to which the user belongs, either through direct membership, through nested groups, or dynamically calculated.

AttributeDefinition.name: entitlements
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of entitlements for the User that represent a thing the User has.

AttributeDefinition.name: roles
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of roles for the User that collectively represent who the User is, e.g., 'Student', 'Faculty'.

AttributeDefinition.name: source
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the external application on which the object lives. If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: nativeIdentifier
AttributeDefinition.Description: The native identifier of the object on the external application (eg - the LDAP DN). If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the Container

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: The display name of the container. This is optional. If null, the name will be used as the display name.

AttributeDefinition.name: type
AttributeDefinition.Description: The type of container (eg - management set or account store). This is optional if the PAM system does not support multiple types of containers.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The ID of the user that owns this container

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: A URI reference to the user that owns this container.

AttributeDefinition.name: owner.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: The display name of the user that owns this container

AttributeDefinition.name: privilegedData.value
AttributeDefinition.Description: The ID of the privileged data.

AttributeDefinition.name: privilegedData.$ref
AttributeDefinition.Description: A URI reference to the PrivilegedData

AttributeDefinition.name: privilegedData.display
AttributeDefinition.Description: The displayable value of the PrivilegedData

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the PrivilegedData.

AttributeDefinition.name: name
AttributeDefinition.Description: A descriptive name for this piece of PrivilegedData. For example, root@mylinuxhost

AttributeDefinition.name: description
AttributeDefinition.Description: A description for this piece of PrivilegedData.

AttributeDefinition.name: type
AttributeDefinition.Description: The type of PrivilegedData. The value will be dependent on what is supported by the PAM system. Examples include 'credential', 'ssh key', 'file', etc...

AttributeDefinition.name: id
AttributeDefinition.Description: The unique identifier of the Group

AttributeDefinition.name: displayName
AttributeDefinition.Description: A human-readable name for the Group. REQUIRED.

AttributeDefinition.name: members
AttributeDefinition.Description: A list of members of the Group.

AttributeDefinition.name: source
AttributeDefinition.Description: The name of the external application on which the object lives. If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

AttributeDefinition.name: nativeIdentifier
AttributeDefinition.Description: The native identifier of the object on the external application (eg - the LDAP DN). If this is a PAM local object, this is null.

entry.value:
select emp.employee_id as empid, emp.emp_firstname as firstname, emp.emp_lastname as lastname, emp.emp_work_email as email, job.job_title as title, loc.country_code as country, loc.city, mgr.employee_id as mgrId, stat.name as status, concat(emp.emp_firstname, '.', emp.emp_lastname) as userid, dept.name as department, CASE WHEN emp.termination_id IS NOT NULL or stat.name like 'Inactive%' THEN True ELSE False END as term, ftostart, ftoend, contract.econ_extend_start_date as contractStartDate, contract.econ_extend_end_date as contractEndDate, emp.emp_birthday as birthDate
from hs_hr_employee as emp
left outer join (select ohrm_leave.emp_number, min(ohrm_leave.date) as ftostart, max(ohrm_leave.date) as ftoend from ohrm_leave group by ohrm_leave.emp_number) as fto on fto.emp_number=emp.emp_number left outer join hs_hr_emp_contract_extend as contract on contract.emp_number=emp.emp_number left outer join ohrm_job_title as job on emp.job_title_code=job.id left outer join hs_hr_emp_reportto as empmgr on emp.emp_number=empmgr.erep_sub_emp_number left outer join hs_hr_employee as mgr on empmgr.erep_sup_emp_number=mgr.emp_number left outer join hs_hr_emp_locations as emploc on emp.emp_number=emploc.emp_number left outer join ohrm_location as loc on emploc.location_id=loc.id left outer join ohrm_employment_status as stat on emp.emp_status=stat.id left outer join ohrm_subunit as dept on emp.work_station=dept.id left outer join ohrm_emp_termination as term on emp.emp_number=term.emp_number

select emp.employee_id as empid, emp.emp_firstname as firstname, emp.emp_lastname as lastname, emp.emp_work_email as email, job.job_title as title, loc.country_code as country, loc.city, mgr.employee_id as mgrId, stat.name as status, concat(emp.emp_firstname, '.', emp.emp_lastname) as userid, dept.name as department, CASE WHEN emp.termination_id IS NOT NULL or stat.name like 'Inactive%' THEN True ELSE False END as term, ftostart, ftoend, contract.econ_extend_start_date as contractStartDate, contract.econ_extend_end_date as contractEndDate
from hs_hr_employee as emp
left outer join (select ohrm_leave.emp_number, min(ohrm_leave.date) as ftostart, max(ohrm_leave.date) as ftoend from ohrm_leave group by ohrm_leave.emp_number) as fto on fto.emp_number=emp.emp_number left outer join hs_hr_emp_contract_extend as contract on contract.emp_number=emp.emp_number left outer join ohrm_job_title as job on emp.job_title_code=job.id left outer join hs_hr_emp_reportto as empmgr on emp.emp_number=empmgr.erep_sub_emp_number left outer join hs_hr_employee as mgr on empmgr.erep_sup_emp_number=mgr.emp_number left outer join hs_hr_emp_locations as emploc on emp.emp_number=emploc.emp_number left outer join ohrm_location as loc on emploc.location_id=loc.id left outer join ohrm_employment_status as stat on emp.emp_status=stat.id left outer join ohrm_subunit as dept on emp.work_station=dept.id left outer join ohrm_emp_termination as term on emp.emp_number=term.emp_number
where emp.employee_id='$(identity)'

select emp.employee_id as empid, emp.emp_firstname as firstname, emp.emp_lastname as lastname, emp.emp_work_email as email, job.job_title as title, loc.country_code as country, loc.city, mgr.employee_id as mgrId, stat.name as status, concat(emp.emp_firstname, '.', emp.emp_lastname) as userid, dept.name as department, CASE WHEN emp.termination_id IS NOT NULL or stat.name like 'Inactive%' THEN True ELSE False END as term, ftostart, ftoend, contract.econ_extend_start_date as contractStartDate, contract.econ_extend_end_date as contractEndDate, emp.emp_birthday as birthDate
from hs_hr_employee as emp
left outer join (select ohrm_leave.emp_number, min(ohrm_leave.date) as ftostart, max(ohrm_leave.date) as ftoend from ohrm_leave group by ohrm_leave.emp_number) as fto on fto.emp_number=emp.emp_number left outer join hs_hr_emp_contract_extend as contract on contract.emp_number=emp.emp_number left outer join ohrm_job_title as job on emp.job_title_code=job.id left outer join hs_hr_emp_reportto as empmgr on emp.emp_number=empmgr.erep_sub_emp_number left outer join hs_hr_employee as mgr on empmgr.erep_sup_emp_number=mgr.emp_number left outer join hs_hr_emp_locations as emploc on emp.emp_number=emploc.emp_number left outer join ohrm_location as loc on emploc.location_id=loc.id left outer join ohrm_employment_status as stat on emp.emp_status=stat.id left outer join ohrm_subunit as dept on emp.work_station=dept.id left outer join ohrm_emp_termination as term on emp.emp_number=term.emp_number
where emp.employee_id='$(identity)'

apply with strategy 'RequestAcknowledge' asking to users with 'CN=HelpDesk,OU=Groups,OU=Demo,DC=seri,DC=sailpointdemo,DC=com' as 'memberOf' on application named 'Active Directory' with 'Esecutori Integrity in Business' as 'ApproversDescription';

AttributeDefinition.name: NAME
AttributeDefinition.Description: An internal name for the role

AttributeDefinition.name: DISPLAY_NAME
AttributeDefinition.Description: The display name of the role

AttributeDefinition.name: START_DATE
AttributeDefinition.Description: The date at which the role becomes valid

AttributeDefinition.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
AttributeDefinition.Description: The date at which the role is no longer valid in the directory service

AttributeDefinition.name: APPLICATION_NAME
AttributeDefinition.Description: Application that owns the information for the role

AttributeDefinition.name: STATUS
AttributeDefinition.Description: The availability of the Role to participate in a workflow process

AttributeDefinition.name: APPLICATION_NAME
AttributeDefinition.Description: Application that owns the information for the responsibility

Application.featuresString: PROVISIONING, SYNC_PROVISIONING, AUTHENTICATE, MANAGER_LOOKUP, SEARCH, UNSTRUCTURED_TARGETS, UNLOCK, ENABLE, PASSWORD, CURRENT_PASSWORD, NO_PERMISSIONS_PROVISIONING
Application.name: Active Directory

entry.value: when Recipient is Requestor then approve with workflow 'Standard' asking to manager of Requestor else Approved end => when has risky role then approve with workflow 'Standard' asking to users with 'CN=SecCompliance,OU=Groups,OU=Demo,DC=seri,DC=sailpointdemo,DC=com' as 'memberOf' on application named 'Active Directory' with 'Security Compliance' as 'ApproversDescription' else Approved end => approve with workflow 'Standard' asking to users with 'CN=OWNER_AD,OU=Groups,OU=Demo,DC=seri,DC=sailpointdemo,DC=com' as 'memberOf' on application named 'Active Directory' with 'Application Owner' as 'ApproversDescription';

entry.value: select * from users left outer join capabilities on users.id = capabilities.id order by users.username;
select * from users left outer join capabilities on users.id = capabilities.id where users.username = '$(identity)';

AttributeDefinition.name: native_identity
AttributeDefinition.Description: Native identity represented by default as loginName@serverName or loginName@databaseName

AttributeDefinition.name: default_schema_name
AttributeDefinition.Description: Name to be used when SQL name does not specify schema

AttributeDefinition.name: modify_date
AttributeDefinition.Description: Last modification date of the login

AttributeDefinition.name: owning_principal_id
AttributeDefinition.Description: ID of the principal that owns this database principal

AttributeDefinition.name: is_fixed_role
AttributeDefinition.Description: If the value is 1, then this row represents an entry for one of the fixed database roles

AttributeDefinition.name: DBUser
AttributeDefinition.Description: Database users which are associated to the login

AttributeDefinition.Description: Database name in which group exists

AttributeDefinition.Description: Database ID in which group exists
